intro: Physostemon humilis, commonly known as the lesser skullcap, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants known for their square stems and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 cm, featuring small, tubular flowers that are usually blue or purple in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Physostemon humilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
